description: Number of ways to write n as an ordered sum of two nonzero triangular numbers.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: nmax = 100; m0 = 10; A053603 := Table[a[n], {n, 0, nmax}]; Clear[counts]; counts[m_] := counts[m] = (Clear[a]; a[_] = 0; Do[k = i*(i+1)/2 + j*(j+1)/2; a[k] = a[k]+1, {i, 1, m}, {j, 1, m}]; A053603); counts[m = m0]; counts[m = 2*m]; While[ counts[m] != counts[m/2], m = 2*m]; A053603 (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 05 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a053603 n = sum $ map (a010054 . (n -)) $                  takeWhile (< n) $ tail a000217_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 27 2013(PARI)istriang(n)={n>0 && issquare(8*n+1);}a(n) = { my(t=1, ct=0, j=1); while (t<n, ct+=istriang(n-t); j+=1; t+=j;); ct; }\\ _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 05 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 20 2000
